byline.contributor: Nicholas Kulish reported from Düsseldorf, Melissa Eddy from Berlin and Nicola Clark from Paris. Aurelien Breeden contributed reporting from Paris, and Jack Ewing from Frankfurt.
byline.original: By NICHOLAS KULISH, MELISSA EDDY and NICOLA CLARK

abstract: Investigators find that Germanwings pilot Andreas Lubitz searched Internet for information about how to commit suicide and security measures for cockpit doors days before crashing plane into French Alps, killing all 150 people aboard.
lead_paragraph: The browser history on an iPad while investigating Mr. Lubitz’s apartment in Düsseldorf included search terms about cockpit doors, prosecutors said.

headline.main: Germanwings Pilot Searched Web About Suicide and Cockpit Doors, Officials Say
headline.print_headline: Germanwings Pilot Searched Web About Suicide and Cockpit Doors, Officials Say

snippet: The browser history on an iPad while investigating Mr. Lubitz’s apartment in Düsseldorf included search terms about cockpit doors, prosecutors said.
